article_title: White House Says DC Circ. Must Review Standing In ACA Case
article_text:
White House Says DC Circ. Must Review Standing In ACA Case

Law360, New York (October 16, 2015, 9:42 PM ET) -- The Obama administration on Thursday asked the D.C. Circuit to review a district court decision that the U.S. House of Representatives has standing to challenge allegedly improper Affordable Care Act spending, saying there are fundamental questions about the separation of powers that the court hasn’t dealt with before.



The administration maintains that U.S. District Judge Rosemary M. Collyer erred when finding that the House has constitutional standing to sue the executive branch for allegedly doling out ACA cost-sharing subsidies without a valid appropriation. The House of...
